thag16.9:1.1_0: Leaving my mother and father behind,
thag16.9:1.2_0: as well as sisters, kinsmen, and brothers;
thag16.9:1.3_0: having given up the five sensual titillations,
thag16.9:10.2_0: the Teacher supreme in the world,
thag16.9:13.2_0: I have not lain down to sleep.
thag16.9:14.2_0: for such a one of steady heart.
thag16.9:15.4_0: was like the extinguishing of a lamp.”
thag16.9:16.1_0: “Now these touches and the other four
thag16.9:16.2_0: are the last to be experienced by the sage;
thag16.9:16.3_0: nor will there be other phenomena
thag16.9:16.4_0: since the Buddha became fully extinguished.
thag16.9:17.1_0: Weaver of the web in the company of the gods,
thag16.9:17.2_0: now there are no future lives.
thag16.9:17.4_0: Now there is no further existence.
thag16.9:18.3_0: that mendicant, a master of psychic powers,
thag16.9:18.4_0: knowing the passing away and rebirth of beings, sees even the gods at that time.”
thag16.9:20.1_0: Then I was reborn in the Sakyan clan,
thag16.9:20.4_0: I was awakened by cymbals and gongs.
thag16.9:21.2_0: the Teacher, fearing nothing from any quarter;
thag16.9:21.3_0: filling my mind with confidence in him,
thag16.9:21.4_0: and then I went forth to homelessness.
thag16.9:22.1_0: and I knew my past lives,
thag16.9:22.2_0: the places I used to live.
thag16.9:22.4_0: and stayed among the Thirty-Three gods.
thag16.9:23.1_0: Seven times I was a king of men
thag16.9:23.3_0: looks all around the four directions,
thag16.9:24.1_0: Seven from here, seven from there—
thag16.9:24.4_0: at that time I stayed in the realm of the gods.
thag16.9:26.2_0: I know the passing away and rebirth of beings,
thag16.9:26.4_0: their lives in this state and that.
thag16.9:27.4_0: the attachment to rebirth is eradicated.”
thag16.9:28.1_0: In the Vajjian village of Veḷuva,
thag16.9:28.2_0: my life will come to an end.
thag16.9:3.1_0: But he has gone beyond all that,
thag16.9:3.2_0: and delights in the Buddha’s teaching.
thag16.9:3.3_0: Having crossed over the entire flood,
thag16.9:4.3_0: having crossed over these as well,
thag16.9:6.2_0: selected rags from the dust heap;
thag16.9:6.3_0: he picked them up, washed, dyed, and wore them;
thag16.9:7.2_0: who has many wishes and is not content,
thag16.9:8.1_0: But someone who is mindful, few of wishes,
